definition[0]: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it
example[0]: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
definition[1]: to go into a place in large numbers, especially when you are not wanted
example[1]: Every summer, the town is invaded by tourists.
example[2]: Fans invaded the pitch at half time.
definition[2]: to get involved in something in an unwanted and annoying way
example[3]: What right does he have to invade my privacy?
example[4]: Patients are given the feeling that they mustnâ€™t try to invade medical territory  (=try to deal with things that are not their responsibility).
